school_name: Georgia State University College of Law
headline: New clinic launched Fall 2022
description: Georgia State launched the Community Development & Entrepreneurship Law Clinic with explicit focus on social enterprise clients.
follow_up_note: Worth reaching out to compare notes on clinic launch

school_name: Case Western Reserve University School of Law
headline: International Development Law Lab focuses on Global South
description: New lab launched in 2024 focused on social impact investing in the Global South. Anchor client is Impact Investment Exchange (IIX).
follow_up_note: Interesting Global South focus - potential collaboration?

headline: 2024 ESG Symposium
description: One-day symposium exploring ESG and responsible business practices. 5.0 hours of CLE credit awarded.

headline: Program on Corporation Law and Global Society launched
description: New program launched Fall 2022 alongside Community Business Clinic. Website sparse but mission aligns with corporate responsibility themes.
follow_up_note: Reach out to learn more about program direction

school_name: Brigham Young University J. Reuben Clark Law School
headline: Law and Entrepreneurship Clinic serves social entrepreneurs
description: Clinic specifically states they take on social entrepreneurs as clients. Business school has Social Venture Academy.
follow_up_note: Connection to business school programs worth exploring

school_name: American University Washington College of Law
headline: Transactional Law Clinic Collaborative formed
description: Clinics from American and Georgetown formed collaborative to provide legal resources to small businesses and nonprofits in DMV area.

headline: Community Enterprise Clinic represents social entrepreneurs
description: Clinic explicitly mentions representing nonprofit organizations and social entrepreneurs in Durham.

school_name: Loyola University Chicago Quinlan School of Business
headline: Leading for Good Conference
description: Annual conference bringing together 350+ executives seeking skills to integrate business strategy and social purpose. Business school - not law.
follow_up_note: Not a law school event but could be partnership opportunity

headline: Symposium on Human Rights Climate Change and Sustainable Development
description: Organized by Global Human Rights Clinic and Kellogg Institute. Now in second year.

school_name: University of California Irvine School of Law
headline: Impact Investing in Tribal Projects Workshop
description: Workshop connecting Indigenous Nations and impact investment communities for environmental justice.

school_name: Benjamin N. Cardozo School of Law at Yeshiva University
headline: Heyman Center mentions ESG
description: Samuel & Ronnie Heyman Center on Corporate Governance mentions innovation and ESG on website. Worth monitoring.
follow_up_note: ESG language on center website - could be emerging focus

headline: CCSI offers executive training programs
description: CCSI offers three two-week executive trainings on extractive industries, investment treaties, and sustainable agriculture. MOOCs also available.
follow_up_note: Practitioner-focused offerings - different model than most
